content.description: Excellent varied climbing starting with a few vertical moves, then a fun and easy knobby slab, and finally some pleasantly surprising movement at the top. Mussy lower-offs.
content.protection: Bolts and mussy lower-offs. Only spaced out where the climbing is very easy.
content.location: Upslope from the rest of Rad Rock, find a cluster of 3 routes, the left-most being a right facing corner. This route is the right hand bolt line.

content.description: Somewhat cruxy start to a rest ledge and then sustained face climbing for about 60 feet
content.location: Starts on the buttress right in the middle of the wall, between Fire in the Hole and Hotter than a Three Peckered Goat.

climbs.name: Hotter than a Three Peckered Goat

content.description: Sustained and very fun 11 climbing on great rock.  It gets a little steeper on top and has a great finish.
content.location: 8th route from the far end of the crag

content.description: Thin start to a rest ledge then onto challenging face climbing to the anchors.

Hairs on Fire is located precisely in the middle of Rad Rock.  It is easily identified by the high first bolt and the large mesquite right at the base that has a perfect chair where the trunk branches.The climb is great as it ascends crimps through the characteristic alligator skin plates up the vertical face.
content.protection: This is a sport route, however, the first bolt placement is a good 25 ft.  off the deck.  Hence the "R".  You are able to get a in a medium nut or cam before the first bolt.  If one did fall it would be right into a mesquite tree, which would not be pretty.  The climbing is easy, but be aware.

content.description: The two first bolts are a bit spicy. Start on the corner, layback and move right to clip the second bolt. Then move up on easy climbing into the face. The last 20 feet get a bit harder. Really fun route!
content.location: Starts on the corner right from the mesquite tree (and the start of Hair's on Fire).

content.description: Moderate 10 climbing with a very fun and well protected roof near the top.
content.location: 5th route from the far end of the rock.  There is a hold that looks like a "natural bridge" near the top.
Third bolted route from right end of wall.

content.description: Face climbing over poor rock to Burning Beer Time anchor.  Several variations are possible.
content.protection: Poor rock relegates Choss House to top rope only status.
content.location: Climbs right of Burning Beer Time.

content.description: Mild climbing up to rest ledge and high 2nd bolt.  From there, sustained, fun face climbing to nice finish.
content.location: Right most bolted route on wall.

content.description: Technical face climbing over well-bolted vertical face.

Rad Rock is the higher of the two most prominent rocks visible from the parking area.  It lies just behind Trad Rock.  Rad Rock contains a number of difficult sport routes in the 5.10-5.11 range.  All in all, it's a great sport crag in an unbeatable setting. 

  Rock quality is generally good, but can be chossy in places.  Use caution on unknown terrain.  Watch out for nesting wasps and bees up on the rock.
